perturbation.changed_text:
1. Definitions. As used herein, the following terms shall be defined as set forth below:

  a. "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time from February 21, 2011 through December 31, 2012.

  b. "Contract Year" shall mean the specific period of time during the Contract Period as more specifically set forth below:    路 Contract Year 2011 (2/21/11 - 12/31/11)    路 Contract Year 2012 (1/1/12- 12/31/12)

  c. "Contract Territory" shall mean the world, excluding countries with restrictions on endorsement deals.

  d. "North's Likeness" shall mean and include North's name, image, photograph, voice, initials, signature, biographical information, and  persona, when used in materials directly approved by North.

  f. "North's Endorsement" shall mean and include North's public statements and comments about Company's Product, provided they are pre-approved in writing by both parties before dissemination.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Contract Territory' is the 'world'. The modified version introduces an exclusion ('excluding countries with restrictions on endorsement deals'). This creates ambiguity as to which countries are excluded and who determines these restrictions. Similarly, the original definition of 'North's Likeness' is broad. The modified version adds a clause ('when used in materials directly approved by North'), creating uncertainty about materials not directly approved. The original definition of 'North's Endorsement' is his public statements about the Product. The modified version adds a pre-approval requirement, which conflicts with his freedom of speech, if not pre-approved, it is not included in definition of North's Endorsement.

perturbation.original_text:
6. Use of F2 Wedges/Using F2 Golf Bag. During the Contract Period and within the Contract Territory, North agrees to:

  a. Wedges. Use Company's F2 branded wedges when competing professionally, conducting public clinics or outings, participating in  public golf events and when appearing at other public functions where it is appropriate to use or have golf clubs at such events (herein  "Public Events').
perturbation.changed_text:
6. Use of F2 Wedges/Using F2 Golf Bag. During the Contract Period and within the Contract Territory, North agrees to:

  a. Wedges. Use Company's F2 branded wedges when competing professionally, conducting public clinics or outings, participating in  public golf events and when appearing at other public functions where it is appropriate to use or have golf clubs at such events (herein  "Public Events'). North will endeavor to use company's F2 branded wedges.
perturbation.explanation: The original version stipulates that North 'agrees to' use F2 branded wedges. The modified version adds the phrase 'North will endeavor to use company's F2 branded wedges', which weakens the obligation and introduces ambiguity. A later section could hold him accountable to the original commitment, but this creates a conflict.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Event of Default.    a. It shall be an event of default hereunder by North if i) North shall materially breach this Agreement and such breach remains uncured  for a period of thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from Company to North, or ii) North shall be indicted for a felony involving  moral turpitude which brings disrepute to the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Event of Default.    a. It shall be an event of default hereunder by North if i) North shall materially breach this Agreement and such breach remains uncured  for a period of thirty (30) days after written notice thereof from Company to North, or ii) North is accused, but not necessarily indicted or convicted, of any activity that could potentially harm the Company's reputation, as determined solely by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition requires an indictment for a felony to trigger default. The modified version introduces a much broader and subjective criterion: mere accusation of any activity that *could* harm the company's reputation, as determined solely by the Company. This creates a conflict because a later section could be based upon North being indicted, when the new definition has already set the bar for an event of default to be much lower.
